results.question: What is a Process Group?
results.correct_answer: A collection of related processes that are managed together as a single unit
incorrect_answers: A single process that manages other processes
A group of unrelated processes running on the same system
A collection of related threads within a single process

results.question: Which statement best describes the purpose of a Process Group?
results.correct_answer: To provide a higher-level management and control of multiple processes
incorrect_answers: To allocate system resources to individual processes
To enforce security policies for all processes
To allow processes to communicate with each other

results.question: Which of the following is an example of a Process Group?
results.correct_answer: A web server and its child processes

results.question: What is the relationship between processes within a Process Group?
results.correct_answer: They are typically created from a common parent process
incorrect_answers: They share the same memory space
They execute on different processor cores
